thread.title: Win an overnight stay and afternoon tea the five-star Goring hotel in London - Terms and Conditions
thread.title_full: Win an overnight stay and afternoon tea the five-star Goring hotel in London - Terms and Conditions - Telegraph

author: The Telegraph
title: Win an overnight stay and afternoon tea the five-star Goring hotel in London - Terms and Conditions
text: 1. This prize draw is open to residents of the UK, Channel Islands, Isle of Man and Republic of Ireland and are aged 18 years or over. Employees of Telegraph Media Group Limited and its group companies, Pride of Britain hotels, The Goring, their families, agents or anyone else professionally associated with the draw are not eligible to enter. 2. Details of how to enter form part of the terms and conditions. It is a condition of entry that all rules are accepted as final and that the competitor agrees to abide by these rules. The decision of the judges is final and no correspondence will be entered into. 3. Entries must be submitted via telegraph.co.uk/goringcomp and entry is restricted to one per person. Late, illegible, incomplete, defaced or corrupt entries or entries sent through agencies and third parties will not be accepted. No responsibility can be accepted for lost entries and proof of despatch will not be accepted as proof of receipt. The winner will be drawn at random from all entries received by the closing date. The winner’s name and county can be obtained by sending a stamped address envelope to: Tea at the Goring Holiday Winner, Telegraph Direct, Telegraph Media Group, 111 Buckingham Palace Road, London SW1W 0DT within one month after the closing date. 4. All entries must be received by midnight on Thursday, September 3, 2015. 5. The winner will be contacted within 14 days of the closing date of the prize draw. Should the Promoter be unable to contact the winner or should the winner be unable to accept the prize, the Promoter reserves the right to award the prize to an alternative winner, drawn in accordance with these terms and conditions. 6. The prize as described is available on the date of publication. Should the prize become unavailable, a substitute of equal value shall be provided. 7. One winning entrant will win an overnight stay for two people in a Delightful King Room at the Goring Hotel, London with Afternoon Tea for two people and Breakfast the next morning for two people. 8. Stay must be taken by 31st March 2016. Blackout dates: 23rd December 2015 – 2nd January 2016 inclusive. Stay will be subject to availability. 9. The prize does not include travel between the winner’s home and The Goring, travel insurance, food and drink, personal expenditure or incidental costs, other than where mentioned 10. All elements of the prize are subject to availability, non transferable and there are no cash alternatives. 11. The winner and their guest may be required to participate in publicity. 12. Events may occur that render the prize draw itself or the awarding of the prize impossible due to reasons beyond the control of the Promoter and accordingly the Promoter may at its absolute discretion vary or amend the promotion and the entrant agrees that no liability shall attach to the Promoter as a result thereof. @telegraph
